main event: A radio engineer observed a bright metallic, cigar-shaped object at an elevation of about 60 degrees above the horizon in Appleton, Wisconsin on July 6, 1967.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 3-5 minutes,The witness, a radio engineer, noted that the radar-like pattern observed was identical to those obtained with radar-type signals,The object was metallic silvery in color without wings or tail,Estimated dimensions were about 50-75 feet in length and approximately 30 feet in width,The report suggests it could be a radar reflection or unidentified aerial phenomenon.
